notes.text:
An update for kernel-rt is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel-rt packages provide the Real Time Linux Kernel, which enables fine-tuning for systems with extremely high determinism requirements.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: Marvin vulnerability side-channel leakage in the RSA decryption operation (CVE-2023-6240)

* kernel: tls: use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt (CVE-2024-26582)

* kernel: tls: handle backlogging of crypto requests (CVE-2024-26584)

* kernel: mlxsw: spectrum_acl_tcam: Fix stack corruption (CVE-2024-26586)

Bug Fix(es):

* kernel-rt: kernel: mlxsw: spectrum_acl_tcam: Fix stack corruption (JIRA:RHEL-29214)

* kernel-rt: update RT source tree to the latest RHEL-9.2 ad hoc schedule build (JIRA:RHEL-30439)

* kernel-rt: kernel: tls: use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt (JIRA:RHEL-26399)

* kernel-rt: kernel: Marvin vulnerability side-channel leakage in the RSA decryption operation (JIRA:RHEL-29687)

* kernel-rt: kernel: tls: handle backlogging of crypto requests (JIRA:RHEL-30451)
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A Marvin vulnerability side-channel leakage was found in the RSA decryption operation in the Linux Kernel. This issue may allow a network attacker to decrypt ciphertexts or forge signatures, limiting the services that use that private key.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: Marvin vulnerability side-channel leakage in the RSA decryption operation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: Marvin vulnerability side-channel leakage in the RSA decryption operation

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the tls subsystem of the Linux kernel. The tls_decrypt_sg() function doesn't take references on the pages from clear_skb, so the put_page() in tls_decrypt_done() releases them and a use-after-free can be triggered in process_rx_list when trying to read from the partially-read skb. This issue could lead to a denial of service condition or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: tls: use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7 are not affected by this CVE as they did not include kernel TLS support (upstream commit 3c4d755). Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is not affected as it did not include the upstream commit that introduced this flaw (fd31f39 "tls: rx: decrypt into a fresh skb").
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
No current mitigation is available for this vulnerability. Please make sure to have kernel up-to-date as soon as the patches are available to make sure the flaw mitigated.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: tls: use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt

notes.text: A flaw was found in the tls subsystem of the Linux kernel. When setting the CRYPTO_TFM_REQ_MAY_BACKLOG flag on requests to the crypto API, crypto_aead_encrypt and crypto_aead_decrypt functions can return  -EBUSY instead of -EINPROGRESS in valid situations. This issue could lead to undefined behavior and a denial of service condition.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: tls: handle backlogging of crypto requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7 are not affected by this CVE as they did not include kernel TLS support (upstream commit 3c4d755).
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
No current mitigation is available for this vulnerability. Please make sure to have kernel up-to-date as soon as the patches are available to make sure the flaw mitigated.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: tls: handle backlogging of crypto requests

notes.text: A kernel stack flaw that corrupted the Linux kernelâs Mellanox Technologies Spectrum Ethernet driver was found when a user initialized more than 16 access control lists (ACLs). This flaw allows a local userÂ to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: mlxsw: spectrum_acl_tcam: Fix stack corruption
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, prevent the mlxsw_spectrum module from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for information on blacklisting a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: mlxsw: spectrum_acl_tcam: Fix stack corruption
